article.headline: San Francisco 64, Loyola Marymnt 52
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Tyrone Riley had 11 points and 11 rebounds to lead San Francisco to a 64-52 victory over Loyola Marymount Thursday night. Riley recorded his fifth double-double of the season as the Dons won their third game in a row. San Francisco (13-9, 3-3 West Coast Conference), which won its first conference road game of the season, shot 49 percent from the field (25-for-51) and out-rebounded the Lions 39-26. The Dons have defeated the Lions 11 consecutive times dating back to 1999. Leading 48-43 with 10:28 left in the game, San Francisco's defense held Loyola Marymount to one basket for the next 8:26. Jovan Harris led San Francisco with 13 points and also had eight rebounds. James Bayless added 10 points and Andre Hazel had five assists. Sherman Gay led Loyola Marymount (10-9, 1-5) with 14 points. The Lions shot just 37 percent from the field. San Francisco went 16-for-32 in the first half to lead at the break 35-29.
